comment.brief: The `ux:Global` attribute creates a global resource that is accessible everywhere in UX markup.
comment.full:
The `ux:Global` attribute creates a global resource that is accessible everywhere in UX markup.

See @Resources for more information.

The `ux:Global` attribute on an UX element creates a single object (singleton) that is globally available.
Using this attribute will prevent the object from being inserted by default the object at its defined location
in the UX tree.

Raised when the location changes.

Use [startListening](api:fuse/geolocation/geolocation/startlistening_bbef95e2.json) to get these events.

The parameter object is of the following form:

    {
        altitude: altitude measured in meters,
        latitude: a number measured in decimal degrees,
        longitude: a number measured in decimal degrees,
        accuracy: a number measured in meters,
        speed: speed measured in meters per second
    }

See [the GeoLocation module](api:fuse/geolocation/geolocation) for an example.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: will contain the new location, see @location

comment.full:
The last known location.

The returned object is of the following form:

    {
        altitude: altitude measured in meters,
        latitude: a number measured in decimal degrees,
        longitude: a number measured in decimal degrees,
        accuracy: a number measured in meters,
        speed: speed measured in meters per second
    }

See [the GeoLocation module](api:fuse/geolocation/geolocation) for an example.

comment.brief: The type of authorization request to make to the user.
comment.full:
The type of authorization request to make to the user.

This property currently only affects iOS. It should be
set before using the rest of the GeoLocation API.

Setting this property to `1`, which is also the
default, for example as follows:

    var GeoLocation = require("FuseJS/GeoLocation");
    GeoLocation.authorizationRequest = 1;

Means that the app should request permission from the
user to use location services while the app is in the
foreground. Setting it to `2`, as follows:

    GeoLocation.authorizationRequest = 2;

Means that the app should request permission from the
user to use location services whenever the app is
running.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
Set the authorization request type1 = When in use (default)
2 = Always

comment.brief: Gets the current location as a promise.
comment.full:
Gets the current location as a promise.

Can optionally be passed a timeout (in milliseconds)
that the promise should be rejected after.

If successful, the promise is resolved with an object of the following form:

    {
        altitude: altitude measured in meters,
        latitude: a number measured in decimal degrees,
        longitude: a number measured in decimal degrees,
        accuracy: a number measured in meters,
        speed: speed measured in meters per second
    }

See [the GeoLocation module](api:fuse/geolocation/geolocation) for an example.

Starts the GeoLocation listening service.

[onChanged](api:fuse/geolocation/geolocation/locationchanged_adbb1cba.json)
events will be generated as the location changes.

Use [stopListening](api:fuse/geolocation/geolocation/stoplistening_bbef95e2.json) to stop the service.

The parameters here are desired values; the actual interval and accuracy are dependent on the
device.

See [the GeoLocation module](api:fuse/geolocation/geolocation) for an example.

parameters.name: minimumReportInterval
parameters.description: how often the position should be updated. Value in milliseconds

parameters.name: desiredAccuracy
parameters.description: how accurate, in meters, should the values be

comment.full:
Stops the GeoLocation listening service.

See [the GeoLocation module](api:fuse/geolocation/geolocation) for an example.

comment.brief: Call `emit` with the given arguments on the underlying JS EventEmitter.
comment.full:
Call `emit` with the given arguments on the underlying JS EventEmitter.

The `emit` action is dispatched to the JS thread.

comment.brief: Call `emit("error", reason)` on the underlying JS EventEmitter.
comment.full: Call `emit("error", reason)` on the underlying JS EventEmitter.

comment.brief: Call `emit("error", new Error(reason))` on the underlying JS EventEmitter.
comment.full: Call `emit("error", new Error(reason))` on the underlying JS EventEmitter.

comment.brief: Call `emit` on the underlying JS EventEmitter with factory-generated arguments.
comment.full:
Call `emit` on the underlying JS EventEmitter with factory-generated arguments.

The `argsFactory` parameter will be called on the JS
thread with a valid context, allowing us to use it to
generate the arguments to `emit`.

comment.brief: Call `emit` on the underlying JS EventEmitter with factory-generated arguments.
comment.full:
Call `emit` on the underlying JS EventEmitter with factory-generated arguments.

The `argsFactory` parameter will be called on the JS
thread with a valid context, allowing us to use it to
generate the arguments to `emit`.

Connect a @Callback to an event.

The @Callback will be called whenever the event is triggered.

Connect a @NativeEvent to an event.

The @NativeEvent will be triggered whenever the event is triggered.

comment.brief:
Returns the file source that will be watched by the Context for changes in Fuse preview.
Override in subclasses and return correct file source to support live updates
in Fuse preview.
comment.full:
Returns the file source that will be watched by the Context for changes in Fuse preview.
Override in subclasses and return correct file source to support live updates
in Fuse preview.
